author: Evilriku13

text:
@Katana991 Why in the world would it damage your computer.. I dont like these people that just think touching their computer makes it spontaneously explode. Its not too hard. The Emulator IS the console but on a computer. ROMs and ISOs -are- the cartridges on the computer, but as for getting them or owning them.. dont ask me. Cant do that here.

So conclusion: Emulator loads ROM is equivalent to sticking a cartridge or CD in a console. Get it yet?
author: Nobody

text: @KirbyChan I believe they "heavily" remixed it for the tabuu theme.. it kinda sounds like it...
author: Gameinsky

text: @Katana991 It's the game data that would otherwise be on a game cartridge or disc. If you open a rom file in an emulator it's like turning on a console with the game in it.
author: WINGMASTER7

text: @WINGMASTER7 Also (I don't understand computers too well), what exactly is a ROM? Is it a disc?
author: Jonathan

text: @Katana991 The patch is entirely safe. Getting a clean rom shouldn't be too hard as well.
author: WINGMASTER7

text: @WINGMASTER7 It won't damage my computer, will it?
author: Jonathan

text: @Katana991 You apply the translation patch from mother3(DOT)fobby(DOT)net  to the japenese rom and then play it in an emulator. A bit of googling should set you up with everything.
author: WINGMASTER7

text: @WINGMASTER7 Just curious, how do you play the fan translated game? Is it a computer download, or is there a game pak haked into and translated into English?

text: I've listened to this song around 80 times so far because it's so awesome.  I've heard people also expressing disatisfaction with today's music.  Any genre of music is fine to me. text: Where the hell is "7/12" used? Isn't the bottom number in a time signature supposed to be an exponent of two (2, 4, 8, 16, 32)? Who the fuck would put themselves through the unnecessary trouble of making each measure 7 eighth-note triplets long. That's just retarded.
